news.title: Decolonising mathematics: Why it’s good for us, how to begin
news.summary: The Twittersphere is awash with pictures highlighting the outcome of decolonisation as a return to a primitive society – complete with donkey-powered ambulances and professors wearing animal skins and throwing bones in class.

news.title: Decolonising mathematics: Why it’s good for us, how to begin
news.summary: At a time when decolonisation is dominating debate at many universities, the discipline of mathematics presents an interesting case.

news.title: Why Math Education in the U.S. Doesn't Add Up
news.summary: In December the Program for International Student Assessment (PISA) will announce the latest results from the tests it administers every three years to hundreds of thousands of 15-year-olds around the world.

news.title: Yes, mathematics can be decolonised. Here's how to begin

news.title: Yes, mathematics can be decolonised. Here's how to begin
